Quickstride nods in agreement.  

" You're right, there's gotta be a way.  =
I have a feeling that Tucson Prime is one of the best candidates, along wit=
h Leo Prime, to get that Job done.  They're the most proactive of the trio.=
  No offense ta Rodimus of course but, I think his experience with Hydras d=
id a real number on him.  I'm sure there's plenty of emotional scarring the=
re.  I really hate Hydras for what he did also but, I look at the bright si=
de too, and yeah that's out there, just onna take some time ta reach it, bu=
t the way I see it, there's a powerful air of determination on the part of =
all the commanders and with that, we might all get what we wish for."

He t=
hen sits up on his rump and looks to Windlord.

" Tucson Prime took one hec=
k of a risk ta get us this far.  He almost lost his own spark ta pull Rodim=
us away from Hydras.  And after ya left the meeting, he pledged ta face Hyd=
ras again in another one on one battle.  History could repeat itself becaus=
e it's the same exact pledge that Optimus Prime made vorns ago when he face=
d Megatron on countless one on one battles.  I read up on this in my spare =
time.  Anyway, getting back to the story, I did a little more research on T=
ucson.  Apparently his specs were based off of Optimus and Ultra Magnus's s=
pecifications, only in a smaller vehicular design at the time.  And before =
he lost his sight, he was one spry little warrior.  Nothing was impossible =
to him but that did cost him though, a lot of time in the med bay, getting =
battle dents ironed out.  But no matter the cost to his structural well bei=
ng, Tucson never refused the opportunity to fight for the loyalty of his fa=
ction which in the long run, lead to the incident where he unexpectedly got=
 blasted off line only ta come around a lot later, finding that he had lost=
 his sight capabilities due to extensive damage to his optic sensors."

He =
then gets back on his hooves.

" losing his sight actually didn't bother hi=
m though.  In fact he adapted rather quickly to his disability which now se=
ems the norm for him.  And there is talk of him finally getting his optics =
repaired.  But there's one tiny formality...  Before Ratchet went off line,=
 the Autobot's Chief Medical Officer, he specifically said and documented t=
hat the complex repair be either left up to him or under his strict supervi=
sion.  I guess he had a real close bond with Tucson back then.  Well that's=
 all I know for now.  We better get back before someone wonders where we we=
nt."

He offers his back to his friend and waits for Windlord to mount up.
=

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Jul 9, 2011, at 3:59 AM,=
 Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Windlord:
>  
> wind=
lord sighed and said =E2=80=9Cbut is something that must be done to protect=
 it=E2=80=9D
>  
> From: Sandy Panico
> Sent: Friday, July 08, 2011 6:29 AM=

> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: Changing times (Cue: All Maxim=
als & Autobots)
>  
> 
> 
> Instinct suddenly floods Tucson's logic circuit=
s as Talon's kiss excites his inner spark.  He could not help but lean into=
 her body with a passionate embrace and a romantic kiss to her lips.  His b=
reathing quickens with passion as his chest rests up against Talon's.  Thro=
ugh his armor it was possible to feel the pulsation of his spark.
>  
> Out=
side, Quickstride puts his muzzle on Windlord's shoulder with a heavy sigh.=

>  
> "Same here, this is the only home I knew of too.  I'll miss everythi=
ng about this planet.  I just wish there was a way we could stay here in se=
crecy so we don't upset the balance of things."
> 
> Perpetually on the mov=
e and constantly busy.
> 
> On Jul 8, 2011, at 1:04 AM, Airshadow Nightstar=
 <airly2002@...> wrote:
> 
>>  
>> Talon / WIndlord:
>>  
>>  
>> T=
alon smiled and kissed Tucson.
>>  
>>  
>> ******************************
=
>>  
>> Windlord=E2=80=99s face turned serious and said =E2=80=9CI reallywi=
ll miss that planet when we leave, I born here... You know, before the neo =
beast wars start, I was here alone.=E2=80=9D
>>  
>> From: Sandy Panico
>> =
Sent: Thursday, July 07, 2011 9:47 AM
>> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>> Subj=
ect: Re: Changing times (Cue: All Maximals & Autobots)
>>  
>> 
>> 
>> Tucs=
on smiles at the sound of Talon's knock and opens the door for her, bowing =
politely while offering his hand in a gentleman manner.
>>  
>> " Talon, th=
ank you for joining me.  Please, come in."
>>  
>> Tucson had never experie=
nced true courtship before but something in his spark was showing him how. =
 It was as if another part of his spark was being activated for the first t=
ime but whatever it was, he welcomes the new sensation gladly.  Now he knew=
 how happy Rodimus felt when he was around Nightlight and the tremendous lo=
ve he experiences every day.  Now it was    Tucson's turn to show Talon how=
 much he loves her, which to him was infinite. 
>>  
>> " Talon I have to c=
onfess, before I met you I didn't know what courtship was and how to go abo=
ut it.  Then that first time when I tried to tell you that I really admired=
 you, I was at a loss as how you would perceive my intentions.  But now, th=
anks to you, I was able to come out of my shell and for that I will always =
love you with every inch of my spark.  And now, here we are, together again=
 and ready for the next step."
>>  
>> He gently takes Talon's hands into h=
is own.
>>  
>> " Talon, will you show me the way?"
>>  
>> Outside, the ma=
re and the filly shake their heads and trot off in the other direction, tha=
nks to Windlord's help.  Quickstride heaves a sigh of relief.
>>  
>> " Tha=
t was close, thanks I owe ya one, buddy.  I am so not ready for a serious r=
elationship right now.  Especially when it comes to attracting Natural life=
.  It just wouldn't be right ya know.  Leo Primes right, this isn't our wor=
ld to upset.  If anything it needs to be preserved.  Ecology is so importan=
t to an evolving planet and there is no need to upset the balance.  I wonde=
r how much of Cybertron is left, and if we still have our world to go home =
to.."
>>  
>> He looks over to Windlord as he sits down in the grass, watch=
ing bees buzzing around opened water blossoms, gathering nectar to convert =
into honey. 
>>  
>>  
>> 
>> 
>> Perpetually on the move and constantly bu=
sy.
>> 
>> On Jul 7, 2011, at 1:49 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@hotma=
il.com> wrote:
>> 
>>>  
>>> Talon/Windlord
>>>  
>>> Talon slowly walked t=
owars Tucson=E2=80=99s quarterts and she glenty hit the door, and waited fo=
r Tucson.
>>>  
>>>  
>>> *************************************************=
**************
>>>  
>>> Windlord started laught for a while then he regain=
 composture and scream in ultrasonic way trying to scare of the wild horses=
.

times (Cue: All Maximals & Autobots)

>>> Ooc: gotchya.
>>> =
 
>>> BIC:
>>>  
>>> Tucson nods and turns to get ready for a little alone =
time with Talon.
>>>  
>>> Yet he turns back to Wheelie.
>>>  
>>> " If tha=
t's what you want, that's fine by me, Wheelie.  But keep in mind, it doesn'=
t hurt to have a friend as well as a comrade by your side. I learned that m=
any vorns ago when I started working with the Autobots.  And yes war is a d=
ifficult time and we can not weaken our defenses but, it doesn't mean we ha=
ve to be anti social either.  Strength is in numbers.  That was one of Mast=
er Yokitron's words."
>>>  
>>> Tucson backs into his private quarters and =
closes the door softly.
>>> 
>>> Perpetually on the move and constantly bus=
y.
>>> 
>>> On Jul 6, 2011, at 10:20 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...=
> wrote:
>>> 
>>>>  
>>>> 
>>>> > 
>>>> > Meanwhile, in Tucson's quarters, =
Tucson looks down at Wheelie and realizes that he had no idea of his change=
 of status, seeing that the last time they were together Tucson was just an=
 average comrade, just a slight larger than Wheelie. He heaves a sigh and k=
neels down to Wheelie.
>>>> > 
>>>> > " I was going to give you a lecture a=
nd a warning but I realize you just comeback online after many vorns . You =
were not aware of my change of status to Prime office and perhaps mistook m=
e for my previous status. I'll let it go this one time, Wheelie but keep in=
 mind that a Prime is a Prime no matter who they are. All right, you're fre=
e to roam the Auto base now. Please try not to get sent to my office again,=
 okay?"
>>>> > 
>>>> > With a smile of understanding, Tucson opens the door=
 to let Wheelie go on his way. Once having let Wheelie free, he waits for T=
alon with a light hearted smile on his face.
>>>> > 
>>>> 
>>>> OOC - Uhm, =
I posted Wheelie leaving your quarters and he never entered them in the fir=
st place, then him heading out. So there's no way he coudl have been there,=
 and he wouldn't have gone back over to them! So will pose this as taking p=
lace out in the ship corridors. Thanks!
>>>> 
>>>> Also, I appreciate your =
posting, but it's sort of weird how you have each and every character of yo=
ur's coming up, then doing something to me, then knowing each and every thi=
ng that happened to each adn every other one that did, and them all having =
the exact same opinions        over on everyone as everyone else did. 
>>>>=
 
>>>> Also, unless your characte ris asuperior officer who's going to emph=
atically order him to do something, please don't pose him going somewhere f=
ar else after you for a setup. Since it's hideously unrealistic for him to =
go back to Tuscon's quarters twice now as you've posed him doing when he's =
not especially fond of Tuscon, nor him following someone else as well when =
I posd him trying to leave. So, if going to go somewhere with him, please g=
ive me a cahnce to respond to it ahead of time. It's two times you posed hi=
m extensively going with your characters when it was not in character for h=
im to do so.
>>>> 
>>>> If your characters have had interactions with him i=
n the past or things I should know of, let me know? As I have no idea where=
 Wheelie interacted with Tuscon or how they would have remotely konwn of on=
e another, and you've posted repeaetdly that Tuscon knows him from the past=
, when I have no idea of that.
>>>> 
>>>> So again, if they've had interact=
ions as NPC's, let me know their generic history so I can respond appropria=
tely. If he's going to be told to go somewhere wtih someone, either give me=
 a chance to respond appropriately if he does or not, or make it something =
like a specific order in the case someone is a superior. And it's also rath=
er weird how your characers come up from nowhere, all have the exact same o=
pininos and back one another up to the hilt on thier interactions and every=
thing. I feel kind of wedged into a corner by this.
>>>> 
>>>> I understand=
 I'm new to the gruop and you've been here much longer, I just feel rather =
hemmed in on the character with what you're doing and am confused as to how=
 things operate, and how you have all of your alts congregating and making =
me feel pressed into a corner.
>>>> 
>>>> Anyways, sorry if this is coming =
fof a bit too negative, thank you very much for the welcome here and for pl=
aying wtih me and interacting with Wheelie.
>>>> 
>>>> <Back In Character>
=
>>>> 
>>>> Wheelie, having met Tuscon up in the hall, gazes over at him, "W=
hat is this with all of you? You're back and forth whatever I do. This is w=
hat Prime is, just a rank? It seems like it's just sort of dank. We had fou=
r of five in a room, that's not a level of doom and gloom."
>>>> 
>>>> Then=
, walking away from Tuscon, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're good with =
all of your friends, congrualtions on the promotion and to whatever ends. B=
ut we, we were never friends. We went back and forth in our ways, and I res=
pect your orders for these days. But we're not here to have fun, we're here=
 to fight and run and gun."
>>>> 
>>>> Wheelie leaning against the wall, "I=
'll work wtih you, if you do tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell. I'd =
prefer to keep my own advice, and I appreciate your friends, they try and b=
e nice. But don't have them ganging up on me and telling me what to do, or =
how you'll react, or on you'll I chew. So by al lmeans, give me some space,=
 we're here to fight for the future of our race."
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>> 
>> 
> 
>=

.  No offense ta Rodimus of course but, I think his experience with Hy=
dras did a real number on him.  I'm sure there's plenty of emotional s=
carring there.  I really hate Hydras for what he did also but, I look =

 ta reach it, but the way I see it, there's a powerful air of determination=
 on the part of all the commanders and with that, we might all get what we =
wish for."</div><div><br></div><div>He then sits up on his rump and looks t=
o Windlord.</div><div><br></div><div>" Tucson Prime took one heck of a risk=
 ta get us this far.  He almost lost his own spark ta pull Rodimus awa=
y from Hydras.  And after ya left the meeting, he pledged ta face Hydr=
as again in another one on one battle.  History could repeat itself be=
cause it's the same exact pledge that Optimus Prime made vorns ago when he =
faced Megatron on countless one on one battles.  I read up on this in =
my spare time.  Anyway, getting back to the story, I did a little more=

nd Ultra Magnus's specifications, only in a smaller vehicular design at the=

 Nothing was impossible to him but that did cost him though, a lot of =
time in the med bay, getting battle dents ironed out.  But no matter t=
he cost to his structural well being, Tucson never refused the opportunity =
to fight for the loyalty of his faction which in the long run, lead to the =
incident where he unexpectedly got blasted off line only ta come around a l=
ot later, finding that he had lost his sight capabilities due to extensive =
damage to his optic sensors."</div><div><br></div><div>He then gets back on=

ther him though.  In fact he adapted rather quickly to his disability =
which now seems the norm for him.  And there is talk of him finally ge=
tting his optics repaired.  But there's one tiny formality...  Be=
fore Ratchet went off line, the Autobot's Chief Medical Officer, he specifi=
cally said and documented that the complex repair be either left up to him =

h Tucson back then.  Well that's all I know for now.  We better g=
et back before someone wonders where we went."</div><div><br></div><div>He =

  <div>" Talon I have to confess, before I met you I=
 didn't know what courtship 
  was and how to go about it.  Then that =
first time when I tried to tell 
  you that I really admired you, I was at =
a loss as how you would perceive my 
  intentions.  But now, thanks to=
 you, I was able to come out of my shell 
  and for that I will always love=
 you with every inch of my spark.  And 
  now, here we are, together a=
gain and ready for the next step."</div>
  <div> </div>
  <div>He gent=
ly takes Talon's hands into his own.</div>
  <div> </div>
  <div>" Tal=
on, will you show me the way?"</div>
  <div> </div>
  <div>Outside, th=
e mare and the filly shake their heads and trot off in the 
  other directi=
on, thanks to Windlord's help.  Quickstride heaves a sigh of 
  relief=
.</div>
  <div> </div>
  <div>" That was close, thanks I owe ya one, b=
uddy.  I am so not ready for 
  a serious relationship right now.&nbsp=
; Especially when it comes to attracting 
  Natural life.  It just wou=
ldn't be right ya know.  Leo Primes right, 
  this isn't our world to =
upset.  If anything it needs to be 
  preserved.  Ecology is so i=
mportant to an evolving planet and there is no 
  need to upset the balance=
.  I wonder how much of Cybertron is left, and 
  if we still have our=
 world to go home to.."</div>
  <div> </div>
  <div>He looks over to W=
indlord as he sits down in the grass, watching bees 
  buzzing around opene=
d water blossoms, gathering nectar to convert into 
  honey.  </div>
